Title: Cost, limited infrastructure fuel 14% telecoms access gaps in Nigeria, others
Summary: The absence of telecom infrastructure, especially in rural areas, is fueling 14 per cent of access gaps in Nigeria and other parts of Africa . This has also been compounded by access costs .

Title: Security chiefs deepen security  ahead of Tinubu’s visit to Anambra
Summary: Security chiefs deepen security ahead of President Bola Tinubu’s visit to Anambra . Security chiefs have taken stringent security measures to maintain peace and order .

Title: We’ve disbursed N54b to 303 schools, 293,000 students, says NELFUND
Summary: Nigeria Education Loan Fund (NELFUND) disbursed N54 billion to beneficiaries of the student loan scheme . Managing Director Akintunde Sawyerr said 293,000 students were affected by the scheme .

Title: Military kills over 13,000 terrorists,  rescues 10,000 hostages in two years
Summary: Military kills over 13,000 terrorists, rescues 10,000 hostages in two years . The Nigerian Armed Forces have neutralised 13,543 terrorists and criminals . They have rescued nearly 10,00 hostages between May 2023 and February 2025 .

Title: Lagos, BoI, Sterling bank pool N10b to empower businesses, create 10,000 jobs
Summary: Lagos, BoI, Sterling bank pool N10b to empower businesses, create 10,000 jobs . Lagos State Government, the Bank of Industry (BoI) and Sterling Bank, yesterday, signed a partnership that would ensure that Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises have access to finance at single digit of nine per cent .

Title: FG opens NITDA South East regional office in Enugu
Summary: The Federal Government has inaugurated the National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) South East Zonal Office in Enugu . The NITDA South East regional office will drive the growth of Nigeria's digital economy .

Title: FCTA adopts pathfinding model to end violence against children
Summary: The Women Affairs Secretariat of the Federal Capital Territory Administration (FCTA) says it will adopt the pathfinding model to end violence against children . The Mandate Secretary, Mrs Adedayo Benjamins-Laniyi, stated this in Abuja on Wednesday .

Title: Pension funds’ investment in private equities rises 299%
Summary: Pension fund investment in private equity in Nigeria grew by 298.7 per cent in the last five years to N155.8 billion in 2025 from N39.08 billion in 2021 . Data released by Pension Fund Operators Association of Nigeria, PenOp, show that after a 9.8 percent decline in investment, pension funds’

Title: Assault: Police demote sergeant, reprimand two others in Imo
Summary: Sergeant Anayo Ekezie has been demoted to the rank of Corporal . He was involved in the assault of a man along the Owerri-Aba Road, which was captured in a viral video .

Title: Osinachi’s husband sentence: Conversation on implications, hope and healing
Summary: We reflect on the sentencing of Peter Nwachukwu, the husband of the late gospel singer, Osinachi, convicted of culpable homicide . We reflect . on implications, hope and healing .

Title: Otti urges overhaul of energy strategy, warns against past mistakes
Summary: Abia State Governor, Alex Otti, has called on stakeholders in the extractive industry to pay attention to the new ecosystem with respect to the business of exploration of mineral resources . Otti made the call while declaring open, a two – day National Stakeholders’ Retreat and Board Meeting of Nigerian Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative

Title: 'Backdoor' one-party state dangerous for Nigeria - Jonathan
Summary: Speaking at a memorial lecture held in honour of the late elder statesman, Chief Edwin Clark, in Abuja on Wednesday . Jonathan emphasised the dangers of political manipulation aimed at sidelining opposition parties . His remarks come amid growing concerns about the shrinking space for opposition politics .

Title: Suspension: Abure, a clown looking for crown - Otti
Summary: Abia State Governor, Alex Otti, has described his purported suspension from the Labour Party by the embattled national chairman of the party, Julius Abure, as a desperate act of a clown looking for a crown . He called on the Inspector General of Police to arrest Abure for impersonation .

Title: Afreximbank unveils $1bn Africa film fund
Summary: The African Export-Import Bank, through its development impact investment investment arm, the Fund for Export-Development in Africa, has unveiled a $1bn Africa Film Fund . The announcement was made on Wednesday via an official statement posted on the bank’s Instagram page . The fund, launched under the Creative Africa Nexus Programme, aims to

Title: Lagos, banks partner to create 10,000 MSME jobs
Summary: Lagos State Government, in collaboration with the Bank of Industry and Sterling Bank, has launched a new initiative aimed at empowering Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises with access to affordable finance and support .
